title: How to write in the first person in the present tense - Quora

response.answer_text: The easy explanation is you write as though you are the one telling the story and that it is happening to you. For extensive examples read some passages from The Hunger Games. It reads like someone is imagining what happened to them, as though it were in the moment. If you can sort of picture someone telling you a story, but they’re so into it they are telling it as if they are reliving it. The first paragraph from The Hunger Games goes like this: “When I wake up, the other side of the bed is cold. My fingers stretch out, seeking Prim’s warmth but finding only the rough canvas cover of the mattress. She must have had bad dreams and climbed in with our mother. Of course, she did. This is the day of the reaping.” That should give you a good example of first person, present tense, writing.

Beatles Movie Help: One scientist is transferring a bomb saying, “I am lifting up my right foot. Now I am…” When those bomb diffusers would try to defuse a bomb, they would talk aloud each step they made (so that if they went up in smoke, the next guy wouldn’t make the same mistake). I now enter the doorway. There is nobody I see. I step inside. I see no dog. …
